plan.plan_title: ATC Glitch on Purple Line (Byappanahalli Depot)

steps.details: Instruct drivers to maintain safe separation; prevent unnecessary train movements until ATC status is clear.
BMRCL ops to switch to manual signaling where feasible and safe to maintain partial service.
Broadcast delays via station announcements, mobile alerts, and social channels with alternate options.
Trigger immediate SCADA diagnostics and attempt controlled system reset with vendor support.
Position staff at busy stations to assist boarding/alighting once services resume.
Limit inbound passenger flow with turnstile holds and staff-managed queues to prevent platform hazards.
Deploy additional station staff and police to manage queues and assist vulnerable passengers.
Guide passengers to less crowded exits and surface transport options to disperse platform crowd.
Frequent announcements and digital updates about expected wait times and alternate routes.
Station medics on standby for heat/stress-related cases due to crowding.
Coordinate with ride-hailing and BMTC to stage vehicles off critical feeder routes and prioritize drop-offs away from congested nodes.
Create temporary bus-only corridors or priority lanes to move large passenger volumes efficiently.
Police to strictly enforce no-stopping on MG Road and adjacent loops to prevent blockage.
Request city-level traffic routing and incident support to manage long-duration disruptions.
Collect ridership, headway, and crowd data to adjust contingency capacity planning.
